thread.title: Marc Anthony's Overseas "Cambio de Piel" Tour Ends With Prosperous Success
thread.title_full: Marc Anthony's Overseas "Cambio de Piel" Tour Ends With Prosperous Success

title: Marc Anthony's Overseas "Cambio de Piel" Tour Ends With Prosperous Success
text:
July 27, 2015 13:11 ET Marc Anthony's Overseas "Cambio de Piel" Tour Ends With Prosperous Success 
The Salsa Singer-Songwriter Tour Wraps Up With Huge Success and Leaves Everyone With a Lingering Feeling 
CHICAGO, IL --(Marketwired - July 27, 2015) - Marc Anthony's "Cambio de Piel" European tour wrapped up triumphant on Saturday, July 18, 2015 at the Ahoy Rotterdam in Rotterdam, Netherlands. According to post-tour reports, the Puerto Rican singer-songwriter's seven-city tour topped an attendance of more than 110,000 spectators from all around Europe. 
The tour's last three shows, which routed to end in Valencia/Malaga, Spain and Rotterdam, Netherlands, ended strong and wildly successful, avowing the public's ecstatic await after a seven-year absence from stages across the European continent. 
Anthony kicked off his "Cambio de Piel" tour across the continent after a seven-year absence from European territory, on July 7, 2015 in Zürich, Switzerland with multiple sold-out shows. There was also a surprise appearance from the Cuban group phenomenon, Gente de Zona, in Málaga where Marc Anthony invited them up to the stage for a brief performance of their famous "Gozadera" dance moves. 
The tour held solid momentum and according to one of Spain's most prestigious publications, Diario Sur, Anthony's performance was 'worth the 55 euros that minimally cost to enter.' Thousands of fans expressed their awaited desire to see the salsa musician perform by chanting,"Esto si que es un pedazo de artista," translated to 'This is one heck of an artist'. 
Anthony continues to move forward with his solo tour Cambio de Piel at famed venues in Mexico and the rest of Latin America, followed by dates in the U.S. in September alongside of Colombian superstar Carlos Vives in UNID2 , a 15-city tour produced by Cardenas Marketing Network, Inc., (CMN). Visit www.CMNEvents.com for upcoming dates. 
About CMN Events: Headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, Cárdenas Marketing Network, Inc. (CMN) is one of the leading Multicultural experiential event-marketing agencies and the largest producer of Latin music events in the U.S. With over 2,800 activations each year since 2002, CMN has been connecting brands with consumers through shared passion points of music, sports, and cultural pride, offering full integration with digital marketing and advertising for all projects and activations. CMN works with a variety of industries, global organizations and emerging businesses, helping them grow and guiding them to become culturally relevant with the Hispanic consumer. In 2015, CMN was named one of Advertising Age's, "Largest U.S. Hispanic Agencies," Crain's "Chicago's Largest Minority-Owned Firms," and has been awarded "Best Event/Consumer Engagement Campaign of the year" by Billboard Latin Music Marketing Awards. For sponsorship opportunities, visit www.cmnevents.com . Contact Information
